page.title: 01AN APEDALE BLOCK SURVEY
page.content: This Domesday Block conists of 16 isolated farms set in Ape-dale,amidst scattered woodland and gently rolling {farmland.}It is bounded on the S.E. corner with the heavily wooded limestone escarpment,termed Wenlock Edge.There are 2 Elizabethan Manors,a few scattered modern homes and several in the hamlet of Plaish.Population is sparse,and one can wander for a long time seeing no-one.It is essentially the Shropshire{landscape}of the writer A.E.Housman.The peace of the area has changed little over the years_"the quietest under the sun".There is no shool-no inn-no shop-no chapel or church,and so it has been for hundreds of years-since the first Domesday Survey in fact.
